snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s State of the City address made clear his impatience with Washington and his challenge to critics in Albany.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio charts robust liberal agenda in his first State of the City address; pledges to bypass Washington to address economic and social disparities by expanding benefits for illegal immigrants including identification cards and pressing for higher local minimum wage; is hoping to follow in steps of other local leaders who have brought about liberal reforms in face of congressional gridlock.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and KIRK SEMPLE
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s State of the City address made clear his impatience with Washington and his challenge to critics in Albany.

headline.main: De Blasio Plans a Minimum Wage and City ID Cards
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Plans a Minimum Wage and City ID Cards
